name: Maize
description: Staple cereal crop, main food source in Malawi.
tips: Ensure proper spacing, timely planting, and weed control.

growth_cycle.instructions: Clear field, plough and ridge 2-3 weeks before planting.
Sow seeds with 75cm spacing between rows and 25cm between holes.
Apply NPK at planting and Urea at 4 weeks after germination.
Weed 2-3 times during the growing season for better yield.
Monitor for fall armyworm and spray pesticides if needed.
Harvest when cobs are dry and grain is hard; Usually 3-4 months.
Dry thoroughly and store in dry, cool granaries to avoid mold or rot.

name: Sorghum
description: Drought-resistant cereal, often grown for food and fodder.
tips: Resistant to water stress, but requires good drainage.

growth_cycle.instructions: Clear weeds, plough field to 10-15cm depth.
Space seeds 45cm apart in rows with 15cm between each seed.
Apply NPK at planting and top-dress with Urea at 6 weeks.
Weed as needed, especially during the first 6 weeks.
Watch for aphids and caterpillars, use organic insecticides if necessary.
Harvest when grains are hard and the plant turns yellow (90-120 days).
Store in dry conditions to prevent mold or insect damage.

name: Cassava
description: Perennial crop used for food, starch, and industrial purposes.
tips: Cassava is drought tolerant and requires minimal input once established.

growth_cycle.instructions: Plough to a depth of 15-20cm, add compost if needed.
Plant stem cuttings 30-40cm long, spaced 1m apart.
Apply NPK fertilizers at planting and top-dress with Urea at 2 months.
Weed the field for the first 3 months to reduce competition.
Watch for cassava mealybugs and mosaic disease.
Harvest after 8-12 months or when tubers reach full size.
Store in a cool, dry place, preferably in a pit to avoid spoilage.

name: Beans
description: Rich in protein, common in both smallholder and commercial farming.
tips: Ensure proper spacing to minimize disease risk.

growth_cycle.instructions: Plough and harrow the soil to break up clods.
Sow seeds 4-5cm deep with 20cm between plants and 50cm between rows.
Apply NPK fertilizer at planting.
Weed 2-3 times during the growing season.
Spray for aphids and root rot if necessary.
Harvest when pods turn yellow and beans rattle inside.
Store in airtight containers in cool, dry conditions.

name: Sweet Potato
description: A nutritious root crop used for food and fodder.
tips: Maintain weed control and monitor for pests like weevils.

growth_cycle.instructions: Plough soil to a depth of 20cm and incorporate organic matter.
Plant cuttings 20-30cm long, spaced 30cm apart in rows.
Apply NPK at planting and Urea 6 weeks after planting.
Weed regularly during the first 3 months.
Watch for sweet potato weevils and whiteflies.
Harvest after 4-5 months when roots are mature.
Store in a cool, dry, and ventilated place to prevent rotting.

name: Groundnut
description: A legume crop used for food, oil production, and animal feed.
tips: Ensure adequate spacing for good air circulation.

growth_cycle.instructions: Plough the soil deeply to loosen it.
Plant seeds 3-5cm deep, spaced 20cm apart in rows.
Apply a balanced fertilizer like NPK at planting.
Weed 2-3 times during the growing season.
Watch for aphids and soil-borne diseases.
Harvest when the plants begin to yellow and leaves fall off.
Dry nuts thoroughly before storage in a cool, dry place.

name: Tomato
description: A common vegetable, rich in vitamins, widely grown in Malawi.
tips: Ensure proper spacing to prevent disease transmission.

growth_cycle.instructions: Plough, harrow and add organic manure.
Space seeds 50-60cm apart with 30cm between rows.
Apply NPK at planting, and top-dress with Urea at 4 weeks.
Weed regularly, especially in the first 2 months.
Control for aphids, leaf miners, and blight with appropriate pesticides.
Harvest when fruits are fully ripe and firm.
Store in cool, dry conditions or process into sauces.
